text: Wow serializing using JLD2 really takes up quite a bit of space. I just stored a few variables that I need later on and the filesize is 2gb

elements.text: Wow serializing using JLD2 really takes up quite a bit of space. I just stored a few variables that I need later on and the filesize is 2gb

text: Woah. What were the types of the variables? I'd imagine that certain things (e.g. closures) could potentially take up a surprising amount of space.

elements.text: Woah. What were the types of the variables? I'd imagine that certain things (e.g. closures) could potentially take up a surprising amount of space.

text:
Substrings are another that can take up a huge amount of space, since they carry the original string with them.
Similar for subarrays

text:
Hi <@U6Z8377N2>,

JLD2 usually tries to be quite efficient. If you think you may have found a bug, please open an issue.
(otherwise, what <@U6A936746> said might very well be true)
